smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function onServiceMessage is nested too deeply.
Function setup is nested too deeply.

Function getNetworkInterfacesWithFallBack is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'StreamFragment' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ExpansionHeader' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ExpansionLayout' with '16' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'AppStateMachineImpl' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function validateCropValues has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class SettingsImageFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class AppStateMachineImpl is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface Settings is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface SettingsReadOnly is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `it.time to it.bytes.bytesToMbit()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `mark to MARK_FORMATTER.format(mark)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `mark to MARK_FORMATTER.format(mark)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `htmlEnableButtons to enablePin`

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (MINIMUM_FOR_MAX_Y_MARK / Y_MARKS_COUNT) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: MINIMUM_FOR_MAX_Y_MARK / Y_MARKS_COUNT

Parentheses in (paddingStart + textPaint.measureText(yMarks.last().second) + 2 * textPadding) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: paddingStart + textPaint.measureText(yMarks.last().second) + 2 * textPadding
Parentheses in (width / 2f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: width / 2f
Parentheses in (width / 2f) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: width / 2f
Parentheses in (state != State.DESTROYED && state != previousStreamState.state) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: state != State.DESTROYED && state != previousStreamState.state
Parentheses in (it is Inet4Address) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it is Inet4Address
Parentheses in (it is Inet6Address) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: it is Inet6Address
Parentheses in (enableIPv6 && (it is Inet6Address)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: enableIPv6 && (it is Inet6Address)
Parentheses in (enableLocalHost && netInterface.address.isLoopbackAddress) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: enableLocalHost && netInterface.address.isLoopbackAddress
Parentheses in (ipInt.shr(i * 8).and(255)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ipInt.shr(i * 8).and(255)

Parentheses in (newResizeFactor != resizeFactor.get() || newRotation != rotation.get()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: newResizeFactor != resizeFactor.get() || newRotation != rotation.get()
Parentheses in (now - lastImageMillis) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: now - lastImageMillis
Parentheses in (1000 / settingsReadOnly.maxFPS) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 1000 / settingsReadOnly.maxFPS
Parentheses in ("--$multipartBoundary\r\n") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: "--$multipartBoundary\r\n"
Parentheses in (now - disconnectedTime) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: now - disconnectedTime
